articles.author: Prasad Rao
articles.description: Thanks to everyone who joined us for the fifth annual AWS Pi Day on March 14. Since its inception in 2021, commemorating the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) 15th anniversary, AWS Pi Day has grown into a flagship event highlighting the transformative power of cloud technologies in data management, analytics, and AI. This year’s […]
articles.title: AWS Weekly Roundup: AWS Pi Day, Amazon Bedrock multi-agent collaboration, Amazon SageMaker Unified Studio, Amazon S3 Tables, and more

articles.author: Sébastien Stormacq
articles.description: AWS Pi Day, an annual event commemorating the launch of Amazon S3 in 2006, has evolved from celebrating cloud storage milestones to showcasing cutting-edge developments in data management, analytics, and AI. In 2025, we're focused on unified data foundation for analytics and AI through new capabilities like S3 Tables, SageMaker Unified Studio, and Amazon Bedrock IDE.
articles.title: AWS Pi Day 2025: Data foundation for analytics and AI

articles.author: Christoph Kappey
articles.description: In this post, you'll learn how to implement Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) in your organization, based on best practices developed from experience with over 200 ADRs across multiple projects. You'll also discover practical tips for streamlining architectural decision-making, see real-world examples from projects with teams ranging from 10 to over 100 members, and understand the common challenges in architecture decision-making and how ADRs can help address them.
articles.title: Master architecture decision records (ADRs): Best practices for effective decision-making

articles.author: Antoine Boucherie
articles.description: In this post, we explore an intermediate strategy between the pilot light and the warm standby strategies: pilot light with reserved capacity. You can use this strategy to reserve compute capacity in a secondary Region while also limiting cost.
articles.title: Pilot light with reserved capacity: How to optimize DR cost using On-Demand Capacity Reservations

articles.author: Suleman Ahmad
articles.description: We are closing the cleartext HTTP ports entirely for Cloudflare API traffic. This prevents the risk of clients unintentionally leaking their secret API keys in cleartext during the initial request.
articles.title: HTTPS-only for Cloudflare APIs: shutting the door on cleartext traffic

articles.author: Mia Malden
articles.description: Cloudflare Aegis provides dedicated egress IPs for Zero Trust origin access strategies, now supporting BYOIP and customer-facing configurability, with observability of Aegis IP utilization soon.
articles.title: Simplify allowlist management and lock down origin access with Cloudflare Aegis

articles.author: Alex Dunbrack
articles.description: Cloudflare’s first AI agent, Cloudy, helps make complicated configurations easy to understand for Cloudflare administrators.
articles.title: Introducing Cloudy, Cloudflare’s AI agent for simplifying complex configurations

articles.author: Michael Tremante
articles.description: We’re introducing a new Application Security experience in the Cloudflare dashboard, with a reworked UI organized by use cases, making it easier for customers to navigate and secure their accounts.
articles.title: Making Application Security simple with a new unified dashboard experience

articles.author: Kenny Johnson
articles.description: We are excited to introduce support for private hostname and IP address-defined applications as well as reusable access policies.
articles.title: Improved support for private applications and reusable access policies with Cloudflare Access

articles.author: Michael Tremante
articles.description: With Cloudflare for AI, developers, security teams and content creators can leverage Cloudflare’s network and portfolio of tools to secure, observe and make AI applications resilient and safe to use.

articles.author: Curtis Lowder
articles.description: By building and integrating a new heuristics framework into the Cloudflare Ruleset Engine, we now have a more flexible system to write rules and deploy new releases rapidly.
articles.title: Improved Bot Management flexibility and visibility with new high-precision heuristics

articles.author: Radwa Radwan
articles.description: Firewall for AI discovers and protects your public LLM-powered applications, and is seamlessly integrated with Cloudflare WAF. Join the beta now and take control of your generative AI security.

articles.description: How Cloudflare uses generative AI to slow down, confuse, and waste the resources of AI Crawlers and other bots that don’t respect “no crawl” directives.
articles.title: Trapping misbehaving bots in an AI Labyrinth

articles.author: Teresa Brooks-Mejia
articles.description: It's hard to tell the difference between web content produced by humans and web content produced by AI. We're taking new approach to making AI content distinguishable without impacting performance.
articles.title: An early look at cryptographic watermarks for AI-generated content

articles.author: Juan Miguel Cejuela
articles.description: Learn more about how Cloudflare developed an AI model to uncover malicious JavaScript intent using a Graph Neural Network, from pre-processing data to inferencing at scale.

articles.author: Alexandra Moraru
articles.description: Gain real-time insights with our new threat events platform. This tool empowers your cybersecurity defense with actionable intelligence to stay ahead of attacks and protect your critical assets.

articles.author: David Belson
articles.description: For Security Week 2025, we are adding several new DDoS-focused graphs, new insights into leaked credential trends, and a new Bots page to Cloudflare Radar.
articles.title: Extending Cloudflare Radar’s security insights with new DDoS, leaked credentials, and bots datasets

articles.author: Sally Lee
articles.description: Introducing new Turnstile Analytics: Gain insight into your visitor traffic, bot behavior patterns, traffic anomalies, and attack attributes.
articles.title: Upgraded Turnstile Analytics enable deeper insights, faster investigations, and improved security

articles.author: Jen Sells
articles.description: Today we are excited to announce support for Zero Trust datasets, and custom dashboards where customers can monitor critical metrics for suspicious or unusual activity.
articles.title: Cloudflare enables native monitoring and forensics with Log Explorer and custom dashboards

articles.author: Zhiyuan Zheng
articles.description: Cloudflare introduces a single platform for unified security posture management, helping protect SaaS and web applications deployed across various environments.
articles.title: One platform to manage your company’s predictive security posture with Cloudflare

articles.author: Radwa Radwan
articles.description: Nearly half of observed login attempts across websites protected by Cloudflare involved leaked credentials. The pervasive issue of password reuse is enabling automated bot attacks on a massive scale.
articles.title: Password reuse is rampant: nearly half of observed user logins are compromised

articles.author: Alexandra Moraru
articles.description: Enhanced security, simplified control! This Security Week, Cloudflare unveils automated botnet protection, flexible cipher suites, and an upgraded URL Scanner.
articles.title: Enhanced security and simplified controls with automated botnet protection, cipher suite selection, and URL Scanner updates

articles.author: Jocelyn Woolbright
articles.description: We’re excited to announce that Cloudflare for Campaigns now includes Email Security, adding an extra layer of protection to email systems that power political campaigns.
articles.title: Email Security now available for free for political parties and campaigns through Cloudflare for Campaigns
